section.title: Description
section.p: COMMIT commits the current transaction. All changes made by the transaction become visible to others and are guaranteed to be durable if a crash occurs.

plentry.pd: Optional key words. They have no effect.

section.title: Notes
section.p: Issuing COMMIT when not inside a transaction does no harm, but it will provoke a warning message.

section.title: Examples
section.p: To commit the current transaction and make all changes permanent:

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: The SQL standard only specifies the two forms COMMIT and COMMIT WORK. Otherwise, this command is fully conforming.
